intro: Monodora tenuifolia var. schlechteri, commonly known as African wild peach, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to peaches, though they are typically smaller and have a distinct aroma. It is often found in savanna and woodland habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems and has traditional uses in medicine and cuisine.
